p: However, as identified by previous authors, even when financial access is limited, strong social capital (such as the application of a traditional Indonesian communal work system, namely gotong royong) can fuel post-flood recovery activities in neighborhoods throughout Jakarta Province [ 107]. Similarly, in the aftermath of the 2011 Brisbane flood, strong social capital was one of the main factors that sped up the post-flood recovery process, particularly in cleaning up the affected areas [ 116].
